resources.string: This sign signals a cow crossing! Look out!
This sign indicates an intersection is upcoming. Watch for red lights and stopped traffic
This sign indicates the road is about to become curvy. Adjust speed accordingly.
The highway you are on is about to become divided. Avoid the median!
This sign indicates a rock fall area. Keep an eye out for rocks in the road
These are the common hand signals. It is important to know these as cyclists use them to communicate, and you might need them if your lights are out!
Usually seen around freeway offramps and one way streets, this sign indicates that you should not enter the road from whatever direction you are approaching
This sign means you can not turn right. Usually because you are crossing a one way street.
No U-turn. Don\'t even think about it. NO U!
Railroad crossing indicator. If you see the arms coming down do not try to beat it!
This sign signals an upcoming stop sign. Slow down and prepare to stop.
Threeway intersection. Watch out for merging traffic.
You will see this sign on the back of trucks. The numbers indicate threat levels in three different categories.
This link below should take you to the official California DMV portal.
This link below should take you to the local DMV office locations.
This link below should take you to a tutorial on the rules of the road.
This link below should take you to a parking tutorial.
This link below should take you to a video on driving tips
